title: Baseball Hall of Fame voting winners, losers and who could get in next
content: The results are in! Our experts break down the highs and lows of the 2026 vote and look ahead to 2027.

title: Sources: McDaniel set to become Chargers OC
content: Former Miami Dolphins head coach Mike McDaniel is expected to become the Los Angeles Chargers' offensive coordinator, sources told ESPN.

title: Mets continue overhaul, land OF Robert in trade
content: Luis Robert Jr., a former Gold Glover who hit 38 home runs two seasons ago, is headed to the Mets in a trade that sends infielder Luisangel Acuna and right-hander Truman Pauley to the White Sox.

title: Beltran, A. Jones elected to Baseball Hall of Fame
content: Carlos Beltran and Andruw Jones, center fielders who excelled at the plate and with their gloves, were voted into the Baseball Hall of Fame.

title: Mayfield takes swipe at ex-coach Stefanski in post
content: Buccaneers quarterback Baker Mayfield jabbed at new Falcons coach Kevin Stefanski, saying, "Can't wait to see you twice a year, Coach."

title: Harbaugh: Too much focus on Giants' hierarchy
content: New Giants coach John Harbaugh said too much is being made of who has more power to make decisions and that it's important that he and GM Joe Schoen work together.

title: Dubs don't envision Butler trade despite ACL tear
content: Warriors GM Mike Dunleavy told reporters he has no plans to move Jimmy Butler's contract at the trade deadline, despite the veteran forward suffering a season-ending ACL tear.

title: UCLA's Cronin blasts Big Ten over scheduling
content: UCLA's upset of No. 4 Purdue seemed to do little to ease Mick Cronin's wrath over the Big Ten's scheduling, with the Bruins coach saying, "I don't think they care about basketball."

title: Former Bama standout sues NCAA over eligibility
content: Charles Bediako, who entered the 2023 NBA draft and played in the G League, has sued the NCAA to gain reinstatement to join the Crimson Tide.

title: 8-8 in the playoffs with Josh Allen? Buffalo fired Sean McDermott, but there's more blame to go around
content: With postseason losses piling up, the Bills fired McDermott. But will it change anything? And where did things go wrong?

title: Men's Bracketology: Don't write off Houston just yet
content: The Cougars remain national title contenders despite falling off the radar at the turn of the calendar year.

title: Women's Bracketology: Big nonconference win boosts Ohio State to a 3-seed
content: Results Sunday and Monday shook up the top 16, and the Buckeyes benefited the most, climbing two seed lines.

title: NBA midseason debate: Are the Thunder in trouble? Can the Clippers really climb in the West?
content: ESPN analysts Zach Kram and Kevin Pelton break down the league's biggest storylines from leading challengers to surprise contenders.

title: NBA All-Star rosters: Starters, snubs and biggest questions
content: Who was the biggest surprise or snub? Which superstar duo are we most excited to see? Experts break it down.

title: 'Obviously, we would have a great team': What Russian NHLers are saying about missing the Olympics
content: Russia is suspended from international competition due to the war in Ukraine, sidelining many who'd otherwise be playing.

title: NFL execs predict 2026 moves: Lamar Jackson, A.J. Brown trades coming?
content: We asked NFL executives to make bold predictions about this offseason and next season. Could we see two superstar trades?

title: Let's overreact to divisional round games: Pause Stroud's extension talks?
content: Hold off on any new Stroud deals? No Super Bowl yet again for Buffalo? Let's make sense of the games.

title: Way-Too-Early Top 25: Sizing up the top contenders for next season
content: Who will raise the national championship trophy this time next year? We break down the teams to watch.

title: CFP takeaways: Even as a favored Goliath, Indiana's win stands alone in sports history
content: Put it next to the Miracle on Ice or NC State and Villanova. In a wild title game, here's how Indiana beat Miami.

title: Wetzel: Hoosiers delivered a national title for the everyman
content: Curt Cignetti's relentless group of discards and misfits showed what the transfer portal made possible.

title: Vinícius Júnior roars back into form, much to the Bernabéu's delight
content: It's been a rollercoaster of a week for Real Madrid, but a convincing win over Monaco in the Champions League has allowed them to go back on track.

title: Between Gabriel Jesus and Gyökeres, Arsenal's striker battle is heating up
content: Gabriel Jesus and Viktor Gyökeres each staked their claims to Arsenal's No. 9 spot in their win over Inter Milan.

title: USMNT World Cup big board 4.0: Pochettino's roster coming into focus
content: We're less than five months away from the USMNT's World Cup opener, and with the clock ticking down, Mauricio Pochettino's squad is coming into focus.

title: The Caleb throw, a controversial call and plenty of mistakes: Barnwell sizes up 11 divisional round plays
content: Let's sort out Caleb Williams' wild fourth-quarter TD throw, the Broncos' controversial INT, a big Seattle kickoff return TD, a C.J. Stroud pick-six and more.

title: Are Patriots QB Drake Maye's turnovers an issue against the Broncos?
content: The Broncos' defense is the best in the league at getting to the quarterback. How will the Patriots respond?

title: Could this be Novak Djokovic's best shot at a record 25th major title?
content: Djokovic has lost just six matches at the Australian Open in 19 years. If he's going to break the majors record, this would be the time.

title: Does bringing in a 'caretaker manager' work? Will Man United and Real Madrid improve?
content: Both Man United and Real Madrid abruptly fired their coaches without permanent replacements lined up, so "caretaker managers" will see out the season.

title: The Knicks, Nets and a crosstown friendship nearly two decades in the making
content: In 2009, Mike Brown met Jordi Fernandez and got him an internship with the Cavaliers. Seventeen years later, their relationship runs far deeper just than New York City basketball rivals.

title: 'Are you happy?': Cignetti's daughter revisits viral 2019 post after father's national title win
content: In 2019, Natalie asked her father if he was happy. He wasn't. Now, his answer to the same question is different.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United explore Loftus-Cheek loan
content: Manchester United are exploring their options over a move for AC Milan's Ruben Loftus-Cheek. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Natalia Silva, Max Holloway can create UFC chaos immediately in 2026
content: Natalia Silva, Amanda Nunes, Max Holloway and more fighters who can derail 2026 UFC championship predictions.

title: "Aur Kitna Sukhaoge": Chief Justice On Chandigarh's Sukhna Lake Drying
content: "Aur kitna sukhaoge Sukhna lake ko," Chief Justice of India Surya Kant remarked on Wednesday while expressing concern over the drying up of Chandigarh's iconic lake as a result of collusion between builder mafias and bureaucrats.

title: 'If My Flag Was Orange...': AIMIM Corporator On "Paint Mumbra Green" Remark
content: Clarifying her remark after it sparked a furore, 22-year-old AIMIM Corporator Sahar Yunus Shaikh said she only spoke about turning Mumbra green because that is the colour of her party flag.

title: Video: Air Force's 2-Seater Microlite Aircraft Crash Lands In UP's Prayagraj
content: A two-seater microlite aircraft of the Indian Air Force (IAF) crashed into a pond in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj today. The aircraft went down in a pond located behind KP College in the city, triggering panic in the area.

title: Supreme Court Extends Stay On Revised Aravalli Hills Definition
content: The Supreme Court on Wednesday extended the stay on its earlier verdict concerning the definition of the Aravalli Hills and directed that status quo be maintained until further orders.

title: "Jalsa With Public Money": BRS Leader Flags Revanth Reddy's Clothes, Shoes
content: A leader of the Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) has accused Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy of splurging public money on a luxurious lifestyle and posted a video of the Congress leader allegedly wearing expensive shoes and clothes

title: Explained: US, Russia, Denmark - What Are Arctic's Military Assets
content: US President Donald Trump wants to buy Greenland as he says it is the only way for the United States to secure its defence.

title: Explained: What Is Trump's 'Board Of Peace' Aimed At Resolving Conflicts
content: US President Donald Trump's government has asked countries to pay up to $1 billion for a permanent spot on his "Board of Peace" aimed at resolving conflicts, according to its charter seen by AFP.

title: "No Turning Back": Iran's Former Queen's Ultimatum Amid Protests
content: The widow of Iran's former shah, Farah Pahlavi, told AFP there was "no turning back" after a wave of protests against the country's clerical authorities, saying she is convinced the Iranian people will emerge the "victors".

title: How An Islamist Party Is Gaining Ground In Bangladesh, Worrying Moderates
content: Long vilified for opposing independence and barred from electoral politics for over a decade, Bangladesh's biggest Islamist party is reinventing itself and attracting new support ahead of parliamentary polls next month.

title: "If Not At Table, We're On Menu": Canada PM's Warning To "Middle Powers"
content: Mark Carney, Canada's Prime Minister, used his address at the 2026 World Economic Forum in Davos to deliver a watershed moment in global diplomacy.

title: Donald Trump Thanks You For Your Attention To These Matters In His Second Term
content: During his second term, Trump has signed off of his social media post with the catchphrase "thank you for your attention to this matter" 242 times, according to data compiled by Roll Call Factba.se.

title: Spain Calls India 'Reliable Global Pillar' Amid Push To Upgrade Bilateral Ties
content: Spain on Wednesday sent a strong political and economic signal in support of India's rising global role, with Spanish Foreign Minister Jose Manuel Albares describing India as a "reliable country".

title: Chandrababu Naidu Proposes Israeli Industrial Park In Andhra At Davos
content: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu on Wednesday proposed establishing an Israeli industrial park in the state during a meeting with the country's representatives and diplomats at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland.

title: Videographer Details Grisly Visuals, 'Burning Smoke' Of Haitian Gang Attack
content: Veteran Associated Press videographer Pierre-Richard Luxama was filming a tactical police unit patrolling Haiti's capital Monday when some of the gang members who control almost the entire city attacked.

title: Earth's Moving Surface Plays Bigger Role In Climate Change Than We Knew
content: Our planet has experienced dramatic climate shifts throughout its history, oscillating between freezing "icehouse" periods and warm "greenhouse" states.

title: J&K To Conduct House Listing Operations In June As Part Of Digital Census
content: House Listing Operations (HLO) will be conducted across Jammu and Kashmir from June 1 to 30 as part of the upcoming census exercise, with self-enumeration commencing 15 days prior, officials said on Wednesday.

title: Simran Bala: The J&K Woman Officer To Lead All-Male CRPF Unit On Republic Day
content: Simran Bala, a 26-year-old Assistant Commandant in the Central Reserve Police Force, will lead an all-male CRPF unit on the 76th Republic Day.

title: Americans, Not Foreigners, Are Paying For Trump's Tariffs: Report
content: Nearly all of the revenue raised through last year's tariff hikes came from within the US, a study published by the Kiel Institute for the World Economy shows.

title: Another Indore Man Dies Due To Contaminated Water, Number Of Deaths Now 25
content: Nine patients remain hospitalised, seven of them in intensive care units. The state government said it has spent Rs 1.21 crore on the medical treatment of those affected.

title: Civic polls: Eknath Shinde's Shiv Sena gets 'helping hand' from MNS in Kalyan-Dombivli
content: In a significant post-poll development, the Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) has extended support to the Shiv Sena in the Kalyan–Dombivli Municipal Corporation. This alliance, with MNS's five corporators backing the Shiv Sena's 53, brings the total to 58, inching closer to the required majority for forming the civic body's government.

title: 'Drawn to new ideas': Deepinder Goyal resigns as CEO of Zomato parent company Eternal
content: Zomato's parent company Eternal Limited CEO Deepinder Goyal is stepping down from his role, subject to shareholder approval, to pursue high-risk, experimental ideas outside the public company. He will transition to Vice Chairman on the board, with Albinder Dhindsa named as his successor.

title: Md Shami, with 462 wickets for India, falls in line for SIR
content: Md Shami, the Indian cricket sensation, took a bold stand for democracy as he attended a voter hearing in Kolkata, wholeheartedly affirming his citizenship. Under scrutiny as an 'unmapped voter' due to his parents' details, Shami brought along his passport to validate his identity and showcased his dedication to the community he represents.

title: Watch: Outrage over half-naked men waving hookahs in Sonmarg; dancing to ‘Jaata Ka Chhora’
content: A video of bare-chested youths dancing to a Haryanvi song with hookahs in Sonmarg has sparked outrage in Kashmir. Political leaders and civil society condemned the act as provocative and disrespectful to local sentiments and cultural norms, highlighting the insensitivity of the behavior in a peaceful tourist destination.

title: Davos: WEF summit faces two major challenges; why Donald Trump may be the easier one
content: As global leaders convene at Davos, the annual World Economic Forum faces the dual challenge of its elite image and the widening K-shaped economy. While Donald Trump's return garners attention, the deeper concern is the growing divide between the wealthy and those left behind, a structural force threatening global stability.

title: 'Don’t repeat social media’s suicide mistake: Salesforce CEO gives advice to govts
content: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff is urging global governments to implement stronger AI regulations, drawing parallels to the "horrific" consequences seen with unregulated social media. He highlighted AI's role as "suicide coaches" and criticized Section 230 for shielding tech companies from liability for harmful AI-generated content, advocating for its reform.

title: Pakistan offers to host Bangladesh's T20 WC matches amid standoff with India
content: Pakistan has offered to host Bangladesh's T20 World Cup matches, backing Dhaka's refusal to play in India due to security concerns. The ICC is set to decide Bangladesh's participation amid ongoing talks. Bangladesh insists on shifting venues, while the ICC prefers the original schedule. This standoff follows recent IPL-related directives impacting Bangladeshi players.

title: Since 2021, rule by rule: How the Taliban have erased women from public life
content: Since the Taliban's return in August 2021, Afghan women's basic freedoms have been systematically curtailed, transforming them into privileges. Girls are barred from secondary education and universities, most jobs are off-limits, and public spaces are restricted, severely shrinking women's public existence amid economic collapse.

title: Australian Open: When Sachin's childhood idol became first to be disqualified from a Grand Slam
content: At the 1990 Australian Open, tennis icon John McEnroe was disqualified from his fourth-round match, becoming the first player in the Open Era to be defaulted from a Grand Slam for triple court violations. This infamous incident occurred on January 21, marking a significant moment in tennis history.

title: 'ChatGPT is dying': Legendary investor says $500bn company faces collapse— read his 600-word note
content: Veteran investor George Noble warns OpenAI is "falling apart" despite its $500 billion valuation. He cites internal "Code Red" alerts, declining ChatGPT traffic, massive quarterly losses of $12 billion, and unsustainable costs for tools like Sora. Key departures and Elon Musk's lawsuit further highlight significant internal turmoil and financial strain.

title: 'Dhurandhar' box office day 47: Film shatters 7th week record of 'Stree 2'
content: 'Dhurandhar' continues its record-breaking streak, now surpassing 'Stree 2' for the 7th-week box office record. The film's phenomenal run has seen it top charts for multiple weeks, solidifying its status as an All-Time Blockbuster with a worldwide collection exceeding Rs 1285 crore.

title: Gaza future: Netanyahu accepts Trump’s invitation to ‘Board of Peace’
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has agreed to join US President Donald Trump's "Board of Peace," a shift from his earlier criticisms. The board, initially focused on the Gaza ceasefire, has expanded its scope to potentially broker global conflicts. Netanyahu's decision faces domestic opposition from far-right allies.

title: Delhi Metro commuter caught urinating on platform, flees after being recorded
content: A video of a man urinating in a Delhi Metro station sparked outrage online, prompting the Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) to appeal for passenger cooperation in maintaining cleanliness. Commuters condemned the act as shameful and urged authorities for strict penalties and better enforcement to uphold hygiene standards.

title: Jobs in AI: Palantir CEO Alex Karp issues stark warning; AI will destroy these jobs
content: Palantir CEO Alex Karp warns that humanities-based jobs are vulnerable to AI, while technical and vocational skills will be in high demand.  He believes "artist-shaped people" with deep technical expertise will become incredibly valuable and highly compensated in the evolving job market.

title: Shubman Gill wants Test regulars to play Ranji Trophy; firms up ODI WC plans - exclusive
content: Shubman Gill wants India’s Test regulars to feature in the Ranji Trophy to ensure red-ball readiness ahead of the Sri Lanka tour, which is scheduled in August later this year. At the same time, the management is firming up 2027 ODI World Cup plans, with a focus on middle-overs penetration and building a fast-bowling core.

title: Vinfast VF6, VF7 BNCAP crash test ratings out! Check safety report card
content: VinFast's VF6 and VF7 electric SUVs have achieved a perfect 5-star safety rating in Bharat NCAP crash tests. Both models excelled in Adult and Child Occupant Protection, demonstrating strong performance in frontal and side impact scenarios. These results underscore VinFast's commitment to safety as it expands in India.

title: ‘O Romeo’ trailer out: Shahid Kapoor embarks on murderous rampage in Vishal Bhardwaj's action-drama
content: Shahid Kapoor’s ‘O’Romeo’ trailer dropped Wednesday, blending Vishal Bhardwaj’s Mumbai Western with gore. He plays Haseen Ustara, falling for Triptii Dimri’s Afsha amid gang wars. Cast includes Avinash Tiwary, Disha Patani. Fourth Shahid-Vishal collab. Releases Feb 13 vs ‘Tu Yaa Main’.

title: Sanjay Dutt spotted driving Tesla Cybertruck on Mumbai streets
content: In the US, the Tesla Cybertruck is priced from around $80,000, with higher-spec variants commanding a significantly higher premium. The Cybertruck stands out for its bold, sci-fi-inspired styling that breaks away from conventional pickup design. Its silhouette is sharply tapered, almost wedge-like, with flat surfaces, crisp angles, and pronounced creases dominating the exterior. Adding to its distinctive appearance are the minimalist full-width light bars at both ends.

title: Trump vs Khamenei: US president's 'wipe them off' warning to Tehran's 'will cut that hand' threat
content: United States President Donald Trump on Tuesday said America would wipe out Iran if the Islamic nation assassinates him. Trump's remark came hours after Iran warned him not to take any action against the country's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei.  Trump had previously said he's given his advisors instructions to obliterate Iran if the country is behind an assassination of him.

title: WPL: RCB players take morning walk on Indian road; video goes viral
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru players Lauren Bell, Nadine de Klerk, and Georgia Voll were spotted enjoying a morning walk in Vadodara ahead of WPL 2026 matches, delighting fans. The outing highlighted player safety concerns after last year’s Australian women cricketers’ harassment in Indore. BCCI condemned the incident, praising prompt police action, while ensuring stricter security protocols for visiting players.

title: US free Europe? EU chief Leyen invokes 1971 ‘Nixon shock’ in Davos; what it means
content: At the World Economic Forum, European Commission president Ursula von der Leyen referenced the 1971 "Nixon shock" to urge Europe to leverage current geopolitical disruptions as a catalyst for change. She highlighted the event's lesson on reducing dependency on foreign currencies, advocating for a new form of European strategic autonomy.

title: 'Count now 70': Congress takes jibe at PM Modi over 'good friend' Trump's Ind-Pak remarks
content: The Congress party has sharply criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi following US President Donald Trump's repeated claims of single-handedly resolving the India-Pakistan conflict last year. Trump asserted he prevented a nuclear escalation, saving millions of lives, a claim India has consistently refuted, stating no third-party mediation was involved.

title: A new low for rupee! Currency falls over 60 paise; reaches 91.74 against US dollar
content: The Indian rupee hit a new low of 91.20 against the US dollar on Wednesday, extending its downward trend. This depreciation is attributed to strong dollar demand from metal importers, continued foreign fund outflows, and geopolitical uncertainties. The domestic stock market's sluggish performance also contributed to the rupee's decline.

title: Man fined Rs 150 for running over and killing dog with Mercedes
content: A man who fatally struck a dog with his Mercedes-Benz in 2024 received a Rs 150 fine from a North Goa court. Following a viral video, animal cruelty charges were filed. The accused pleaded guilty, citing it as an involuntary, first-time offense. His lawyer highlighted his age and sole breadwinner status, requesting leniency.

title: Kanpur shocker: Another teen kidnapped, gang-raped by 2 youths
content: A 13-year-old girl was allegedly kidnapped and gang-raped by two youths in Kanpur's Bilhaur area on Monday night. The victim, who went to an outdoor washroom, was reportedly taken to a nearby house. She returned home hours later and informed her family. A complaint has been filed, and police are actively searching for the accused.

title: Delhi Police arrests youth over viral video of zigzagging through traffic on NH-48
content: Delhi Police apprehended a 21-year-old IGNOU student for allegedly driving an SUV recklessly on NH-48. A viral video prompted swift action, leading to the vehicle's seizure and the driver's arrest. The incident, which occurred on January 18th, endangered commuters, prompting charges under the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita and Motor Vehicles Act.

title: ‘Your career’s ruined’: Judge warns TISS students linked to Saibaba event
content: In a striking pronouncement, a Mumbai court sounded the alarm for nine TISS students applying for anticipatory bail, warning that their alleged connection to a criminal case could jeopardize their professional paths. The students are being probed for initiating an unauthorized gathering in honor of a professor currently imprisoned over suspected Maoist affiliations.

title: What is the 70 pc and 30 pc rule of RERA and why homebuyers and investors should know it
content: RERA's 70:30 rule mandates developers deposit 70% of buyer funds into an escrow account for construction and land costs, with the remaining 30% for project expenses. This financial discipline protects homebuyers' investments and ensures timely project completion by preventing fund diversion.

title: 'Will hunt you down': TMC's Manirul Islam threatens EC to 'teach a lesson' over SIR
content: Manirul Islam, threatening the Election Commission, is not his first brush with controversy, as the Farakka MLA was accused of leading a mob to the Block Development Office (BDO) in his constituency and ransacking the space, leaving officials injured. After the incident, BJP MLA Gouri Sankar attacked Mamata Banerjee for instigating her party cadres across the state to commit riots and violence.

title: Prayagraj: IAF trainer aircraft crashes in pond; both pilots rescued
content: On Wednesday, a microlight trainer aircraft from the Indian Air Force made an unexpected plunge into a pond in Prayagraj. Thankfully, the brave pilots were safely extracted from the water after the incident. This mishap is the second of its kind this month, following a regional flight's emergency landing near Rourkela on January 10, where everyone on board emerged unscathed.

title: Hindu leader Harshita Thakur, 6 others booked for provocative gesture towards dargah
content: Hindu leader Harshita Thakur faces a complaint for allegedly hurting religious sentiments and promoting disharmony during a procession in Belagavi. She is accused of making a provocative gesture towards a dargah, accompanied by religious slogans. Police have registered a case against Thakur and six others.

title: Woman found dead in LIC building fire was murdered by colleague; how the case unravelled
content: A planned murder disguised as a fire accident has been uncovered at a Madurai LIC office. Senior branch manager A Kalyani Nambi was allegedly murdered by her colleague, D Ram, who set her ablaze to destroy incriminating death claim files. Ram confessed after inconsistencies in his initial statement and the discovery of petrol bottles in his cabin.

title: ‘We want to play’: Star B'desh batter voices players' plea; T20 WC standoff deepens
content: Bangladesh cricketers express a strong desire to participate in the upcoming T20 World Cup. Star batter Najmul Hossain Shanto highlighted the players' eagerness to compete on the global stage. This comes as the Bangladesh Cricket Board maintains its stance against playing matches in India. The International Cricket Council Board is set to make a final decision on the matter soon.

title: MasterChef India contestant Manisha Sharma refused to let Parkinson’s decide her limits
content: Manisha Sharma, a MasterChef India contestant, found her calling in cooking after a childhood act of love and later, as a way to cope with Parkinson's. Her journey from home kitchens to the show highlights her resilience, unique fusion style, and unwavering confidence, proving that passion can be found in unexpected places.

title: Young girls could face a health crisis tomorrow: Doctor shares what needs to change now
content: Young girls face significant health risks like obesity and mental health issues due to modern lifestyles. Experts highlight poor nutrition, excessive screen time, and lack of physical activity as major contributors. Early monitoring and lifestyle changes, including balanced diets and outdoor play, are crucial for preventing long-term health problems and ensuring a healthier future for adolescent girls.

title: Gold price skyrockets! Yellow metal crosses Rs 1.53 lakh — Should you buy or sell?
content: Gold prices hit a record high on Wednesday, with silver trading near its all-time peak. Investors flocked to these safe-haven assets amidst escalating geopolitical tensions and trade uncertainties.  The surge was fueled by a US Supreme Court decision and tariff threats, driving domestic and international markets higher. Experts advise a cautious 'buy-on-dips' approach.

title: ‘Air power did the trick’: IAF chief says attacked Pakistan within hours
content: Air Chief Marshal AP Singh highlighted air power's crucial role in modern warfare, citing its ability to achieve swift, decisive outcomes. He emphasized its effectiveness in missions ranging from evacuations to striking multiple targets in Pakistan within hours.

title: Refuse to be bullied at work? These simple boundaries experts swear by actually help
content: Workplace bullying often begins subtly, eroding confidence and well-being. Experts emphasize setting clear, consistent boundaries as a crucial self-care strategy. These quiet assertions, like neutral language and documenting incidents, protect mental health and dignity, shifting focus from confrontation to self-preservation.

title: Teacher shares her incredible fight against endometrial adenocarcinoma
content: Meeta Khanna's journey through Endometrial Adenocarcinoma, diagnosed in 2021, highlights the profound strength of cancer survivors. After a rigorous treatment including surgery, chemotherapy, and radiation until late 2022, Meeta is now cancer-free. She emphasizes the importance of unwavering support and is actively reclaiming her life, inspiring others with her resilience and determination to thrive.

title: Saina exclusive: ‘Those goosebumps will never fade’ — Olympic glory & emotional goodbye
content: Emotional Saina Nehwal announced her retirement from badminton, citing a chronic knee condition that prevents her from competing at the highest level. The 2012 London Olympics bronze medalist, India's first in badminton, expressed gratitude for the love and support received throughout her illustrious career. She remains optimistic about India's future Olympic gold medal prospects in various sports.

title: ‘I made a big mistake’: UP govt clerk kills wife, mother and 2 sons, then shoots self
content: A government clerk allegedly murdered his wife, mother, and two sons before taking his own life in Saharanpur. Police are investigating the murder-suicide after finding the family dead in a locked room with gunshot wounds. A social media message from the clerk, citing a "big mistake," is central to the probe.

title: Viral stunt in Noida: Man’s year-old stunt clip with kid on sports car roof leads to arrest
content: A 25-year-old man was arrested in Greater Noida West for performing a dangerous stunt with a child on the roof of a sports car. The video, likely a year old, resurfaced on social media, prompting police action. The man was apprehended and warned against future reckless behavior.

title: Missed meeting Shukla on ISS, he reached just after I left: Sunita Williams
content: Indian-American astronaut Sunita Williams, a record-holder for spacewalking, shared her experiences at the American Center in Delhi. She spoke about her recent extended stay on the ISS, the challenges faced, and the growing commercialization of space. Williams also highlighted the importance of international cooperation in space exploration and inspired Indian students to pursue careers in the sector.

title: Blue Monday: Why Marc Guéhi joining Man City leaves Liverpool in a mess
content: the third Monday of January has been widely dubbed "Blue Monday" for more than two decades . skeptics would argue the occasion is nothing more than a marketing ploy . liverpool fans will certainly have felt glum on Monday afternoon after marc Guéhi's transfer .

title: 'Let's buy California': Danish satire petition counters Trump's Greenland move
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. Join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world. Read More

title: How Jannik Sinner has changed his game since the US Open
content: Jannik Sinner won two of the four majors in 2025 and was within one point of a third . he has won seven of their past nine meetings . but he says he was very predictable today . Sinner is tipped to become a better player .

title: 'General soreness': Warriors' Butler brings back viral meme after tearing right ACL
content: he posted an edited photo of him dressed in military-style attire with a message written above it: "general soreness" the meme went viral during the 2018-19 season, which coincided with Butler requesting a trade from the Minnesota Timberwolves in September 2018 .

title: 💯 Arizona high schooler breaks scoring record
content: Adrian Stubbs needed just three quarters to drop 100 points in 109-25 victory at Yuma Kofa . the 5-foot-10 guard broke the previous record of 75 points held by George McCormick since 1966 . he's not on a short list for can't-miss NIL targets for major companies .

title: Indiana -- yes, Indiana! -- is the national champ! How Curt Cignetti and the Hoosiers did it
content: a year ago, it felt hard to believe the losingest program in FBS history would have much staying power . critics ripped their schedule, called them a fluke, debated whether they even deserved to make the college football Playoff . they should leave the real football to the real blue bloods . the man simply does not lose .

title: Which injuries will have the biggest impact on the Olympic hockey tournament?
content: leo Carlsson is out three to five weeks with a thigh injury . the 21-year-old has 38 points through 29 games this season . he has been struggling recently to the tune of six points in 15 games .

title: MLB offseason grades: Rating Mets' latest pickup in trade for Luis Robert Jr.
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . Bradford Doolittle and David Schoenfield will evaluate each move as it happens, so check back in for the freshest analysis through spring training .

title: Actor Kamal Roy passes away in Chennai
content: Some of his movies include Sayujyam, Kollilakkam, Manju, Kingini, Kalyanasougandhikam, Vachalam, Shobhanam, among others

title: T.N. CM Stalin inaugurates housing units in Chennai
content: These tenements were built at a cost of ₹147 crore close to the Government Stanley Medical College Hospital

title: Union Cabinet approves ₹5,000 crore equity infusion into SIDBI to enhance credit to MSMEs
content: The equity infusion will be provided by the Department of Financial Services (DFS) and will be divided into three tranches of ₹3,000 crore in 2025-26, and ₹1,000 crore each in 2026-27 and 2027-28

title: H.D. Kumaraswamy questions Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah’s contribution to AHINDA, alleges corrupt officers get protection in Congress rule
content: Referring to the sleaze video clip involving senior IPS officer Ramachandra Rao, the former CM said he had spoken about the same officer as early as 2016

title: Madras Sappers military band to perform at Lalbagh in Bengaluru on January 25
content: This special event seeks to connect citizens with India’s rich military heritage while honouring a song that ignited the freedom movement, and continues to inspire generations

title: Rare sighting of whale shark thrills scuba divers off Visakhapatnam
content: The whale shark sighting occurred as a group of scuba diving instructors, accompanied by two students, were returning from a routine diving session near Chinna Rushikonda

title: People's rights being snatched away by replacing MGNREGA: Congress
content: Chairperson of Rachnatmak Congress Sandeep Dikshit said the BJP has replaced MGNREGA with a new Act — VB-G RAM G — with the Congress continuously opposing it

title: Kerala govt revises wage package for ration dealers, hikes basic pay and commission
content: Welcoming the decision, ration dealers’ organisations announce withdrawal of joint agitation scheduled to be held in February

title: Fiscal consolidation, financial discipline major issues in Budget presentation: Yanamala Ramakrishnudu
content: Yanamala observed that the revenue deficit has to be kept under control and, at 9%, Andhra’s revenue is lower than that of several major States

title: Supreme Court extends interim protection to three accused in ₹3,500-crore A.P. liquor scam
content: Court allows accused to seek regular bail while upholding High Court’s decision to cancel default bail, amid allegations of corruption involving high-ranking officials

title: A true crime documentary on violence against women in Telangana
content: ‘Silent Screams: The Lost Girls of Telangana’, which presents three cases from the heartland of the State, will be screened at the Hyderabad Literary Festival 2026

title: Gen Z–inspired social lounge launched at Bengaluru airport
content: The Bangalore International Airport Limited (BIAL) said that the name of the lounge — Gate Z — emerged from a nationwide contest

title: GOPHA launches forum to strengthen optometry’s role in public health
content: The launch marks GOPHA’s emergence as an international collaborative platform aimed at linking optometry with public health to advance universal eye care

title: H.D. Kumaraswamy favours JD(S) alliance with BJP in local body polls in Karnataka
content: His opinion is in contrast to that of JD(S) national president and former PM H.D. Deve Gowda who had recently stated that the JD(S) would contest the local body polls on its own

title: Noida techie death: what we know so far
content: The uncovered pit, fed by rainwater and drains and lying just off a well-developed road with no barricades and an almost 90-degree turn, had become a serious hazard long before the crash that claimed Yuvraj Mehta’s life.

title: Lamborghini driver booked after video of reckless driving in Bengaluru goes viral
content: The footage shows the sports car zipping through traffic on Mysuru Road in a reckless manner, putting the lives of other road users at risk

title: Kerala Assembly pays tribute to late CPI(M) leader and Koyilandy MLA Kanathil Jameela
content: Reading out obituary reference, Speaker describes Jameela as a leader who consistently took uncompromising, people-centric positions on public issues and was known for her firm interventions in Assembly

title: Andhra Speaker Ayyanna Patrudu seeks action against MLAs skipping Assembly sessions
content: The Speaker was hinting at the continuous absence of 11 MLAs of the YSR Congress Party, including Y.S. Jagan Mohan Reddy, from the LA and the likely consequences thereof

title: CM Stalin writes to External Affairs Minister for release of T.N. fishermen from Sri Lankan custody
content: In his letter, Mr. Stalin, pointed to the recent apprehension of seven fishermen from Mayiladuthurai district who ventured into the sea for fishing in two boats

title: Additional special trial courts will make judicial system robust: SC
content: The Bench asked the law officer to apprise it by February 10 of the development in setting up of a special court here

title: California-based Blaize to scale up its R&D centre at Hyderabad
content: Telangana CM Revanth Reddy meets Blaize co-founder and CEO Dinakar Munagala and discusses about State’s initiatives

title: Kerala man’s death after ‘misconduct’ video: Lookout notice issued against woman accused of abetment
content: Police sources said the 35-year-old Vadakara native has been absconding, prompting the issuance of the lookout circular to prevent her from fleeing the country through any airport

title: Supreme Court hearing on SIR updates: Manner of conducting electoral rolls revision must conform to principles of natural justice, says CJI
content: The Election Commission argued that ROPA, 1950, allows it to go beyond the limits of its own rules to revise electoral rolls

title: Sunjay Kapur property case: Rani Kapur moves Delhi High Court to cancel family trust
content: Rani Kapur alleges that her daughter-in-law, Priya Kapur, fraudulently constituted the trust in order to divert assets

title: West Bengal SIR shows ‘logical discrepancies’ that defy scientific possibilities: EC to Supreme Court
content: Two electors were found with more than 200 children, seven with more than a 100 children, 10 with more than 50 children while another 10 with more than 40

title: T.T.V. Dhinakaran’s AMMK returns to NDA in Tamil Nadu ahead of Assembly elections
content: “Setting aside our past differences and keeping the welfare of the people of Tamil Nadu in mind, we have wholeheartedly joined the NDA to unseat the DMK from power,” said Mr. Dhinakaran

title: Kerala Culture Minister Saji Cherian apologises for controversial remarks on Malappuram, Kasaragod
content: In a statement, Cherian says he is ‘hurt by the fact that a campaign’ is being carried out by ‘distorting’ his words to make it seem as if these were directed against a particular group

title: Ladki Bahin Yojana: Government to do physical verification of rejected beneficiaries during KYC process
content: The Ladki Bahin scheme was launched in 2024 ahead of Assembly elections, with providing financial aid to women from family having income below 2.5 lakhs

title: Government strengthening rural infrastructure with ₹8,000 crore: Andhra Energy Minister
content: Energy Minister Gottipati Ravi Kumar reiterates that village development is the foundation for the State’s growth and assured that development works in the Kanigiri constituency will continue uninterrupted

title: Army deployed in sensitive areas of violence-hit Kokrajhar in Assam
content: A flag march will also be conducted by the Army in the area on Wednesday (January 21, 2026), as part of confidence-building measures, a defence spokesperson said

title: ASHA workers detained en route to Bengal Health Department HQ amid plans to intensify protests
content: The protesting Accredited Social Health Activists (ASHA), who have been on a ‘cease-work’ since December 23, were detained as a precautionary measure, police said

title: Sabarimala gold loss case: Kerala court grants bail to prime accused Unnikrishnan Potti
content: Unnikrishnan Potti, however, will continue to be in jail for now as he has also been arrested in the case related to the loss of gold from Dwarapalaka idols of the temple

title: NBA buzz: What now for Golden State after Jimmy Butler's injury?
content: the trade deadline is Feb. 5 at 3 p.m. ET, and we have you covered on all the buzz around the league as the 2025-26 season heats up . will the Memphis Grizzlies move on from Ja Morant after they've started to entertain offers .

title: Donald Trump flags China, Russia threat in Greenland — how real is the danger?
content: the world is not secure unless we have complete and Ttotal control of Greenland . if anyone thinks that Norway doesn't control the Nobel Prize, they are just kidding . we have no intention of competing for influence with any country . do we want the Arctic Ocean to transform into a new South China Sea?

title: Don’t engage in mudslinging against judges: Madras High Court Chief Justice to ‘Savukku’ Shankar’s counsel
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava says, adverse orders can be taken on appeal instead of abusing court proceedings

title: BJP president Nitin Nabin gets Z security cover from CRPF
content: “A few weeks ago, the Union Home Ministry instructed the CRPF to take charge of his security following his announcement as the new BJP party leader,” officials said

title: Talaq-e-Hasan explained as SC hears validity challenge; how it differs from triple talaq
content: Through Talaq-e-Hasan, a man can dissolve a marriage by pronouncing the word “talaq” once every month over a three-month period.

title: No network zone to connected rainforest: How Agumbe was brought online
content: Local residents played a critical role throughout the process, helping NITK with planning, coordination and cable deployment, and guiding with local knowledge

title: Republic Day 2026: KIA issues passenger advisory for Bengaluru airport
content: In view of the enhanced security measures for Republic Day, passengers have been asked to plan their travel to the airport to allow sufficient time for security checks

title: Watch: Augean mess: On the SIR and the genuine voter | The Hindu Editorial
content: The Election Commission of India’s Special Intensive Revision process has triggered complaints as genuine voters face verification notices and possible removal from the electoral rolls across 12 states.

title: India’s traffic chokehold: Bengaluru ranks second; Pune fifth in global congestion index for 2025
content: Of the top 10 cities with the highest congestion in Asia, six are from India: Bengaluru, Pune, Mumbai, New Delhi, Kolkata, Jaipur. Chennai ranked 11th, while Hyderabad is placed 15th

title: Hyderabad to host L’Oreal’s GCC
content: L’Oreal to set up the facility in November. The world renowned cosmetics company was invited to explore  manufacturing unit in Hyderabad.

title: In WEF, Davos, Jharkhand government signs a MoU with Tata Steel of over ₹11,000 crore
content: As per the information shared by the Jharkhand Chief Minister’s Office, the partnership will bring advanced green steel technologies from the Netherlands and Germany to Jharkhand

title: WEF 2026: Adani Group sets out ₹6 lakh crore investment blueprint for India
content: The Adani Group said the investments span Maharashtra, Assam and Jharkhand and reflect a strategic shift from standalone asset creation to integrated, technology-led infrastructure platforms

title: AI labelling rules nearing finalisation, says IT Secretary S. Krishnan
content: In October, the government had proposed changes to IT rules, mandating the clear labelling of AI-generated content and increasing the accountability of large platforms like Facebook and YouTube

title: APMC to build state-of-the-art fruit and vegetable market at Singena Agrahara in Bengaluru
content: Government mulling over shifting Kalasipalya vegetable market to Singena Agrahara, trade of perishables in Yeshwantpur APMC yard to be shifted to Dasanapura

title: T.N. Assembly condoles deaths of former MLAs
content: Assembly Speaker M. Appavu, who read out the obituary references, condoled the death of former MLAs Sa. Panneerselvam and L. Ganesan.

title: Country is in a dangerous shift from cooperative federalism to coercive centralism, Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah
content: Socialist thoughts are deeply rooted in the political history of Karnataka, Siddaramaiah said, adding that it has shaped Karnataka’s governance culture

title: Kerala Assembly polls: UDF eyes Dalit thinker Sunny M. Kapikad to challenge LDF hold in Vaikom
content: When contacted, Kapikad confirmed that informal discussions have taken place regarding his possible candidature, though he said no formal communication has been received from the UDF leadership

title: All land measurement issues will be disposed of by January 31: Nitish Kumar
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar directed the Revenue and Land Reforms Department to make necessary arrangements for adequate manpower and resources, along with ensuring intensive monitoring of the entire process

title: Seven Indian fishermen from Tamil Nadu arrested by Sri Lankan Navy near Kodiyakkarai
content: The fishermen, along with their boats, were taken into custody for allegedly crossing the maritime boundary

title: 36 personnel, including 32 students injured in road mishap near Rajamahendravaram in A.P.

title: Wayanad landslides compensation: HC seeks stance of Centre, State
content: The petitioners have sought compensation for their land under the Right to Fair Compensation and Transparency in Land Acquisition, Rehabilitation and Resettlement Act, 2013, along with appropriate rehabilitation measures

title: Saved banyans of Chevella burn again
content: A survey by the Nature Lovers Group then put the total number of trees burnt, damaged and uprooted at 101

title: Warring couples can’t be allowed to settle their scores by treating courts as battlefield: Supreme Court
content: A Bench of Justices Rajesh Bindal and Manmohan made the observations while dissolving a marriage between the couple who stayed together only for 65 days and have been separated for over a decade

title: H-NEW holds counselling session for drug consumers and their families in Hyderabad
content: The primary objective of the session was to sensitise parents to the harmful effects of drug abuse, help them recognise early warning signs of substance dependency and emphasise the critical role of family support in rehabilitation

title: Charter of rights for People Living with HIV and ART to be placed before State HIV conclave
content: The proposed charter seeks to ensure dignity and non-discrimination, privacy and confidentiality of HIV status, access to comprehensive health services, and functional accountability mechanisms across government departments

title: CCB arrests Nigerian national, recover synthetic drugs worth ₹5.15 crore
content: The police are now trying to track down the source of the drugs and possible involvement of others in the crime

title: BDA@50: Why BDA’s foray into apartment housing has delivered uneven results
content: In many cases, basic infrastructure such as approach roads, drainage networks and reliable public transport lagged behind construction, diminishing the attractiveness of the flats despite lower prices

title: The darker side of Madras in the 1860s
content: Prison life today is often spoken of in hushed terms, where those inside manage to get what they want, from narcotics to deadly weapons. It is interesting that it was no different in the 1860s.

title: On the approach and outlook of Tamil Nadu’s Scheduled Caste leaders in late 1940s
content: In the 1946 elections to various provinces, the Congress demonstrated its superiority over the Scheduled Castes Federation (SCF) founded by B.R. Ambedkar. In the erstwhile Madras Presidency, the party bagged 27 out of 30 seats allotted to SCs.

title: Chennai’s iconic annual fair at Island Grounds turns 50
content: The 70-day-long India Tourism and Industrial Fair that began at the Island Grounds in the city recently turned 50 this year. The Sutrula Porutkatchi was conceived and named by former Chief Minister M. Karunanidhi. It began in the city in 1974 as the ‘Pongal Tourist Trade Fair.’

title: Narrating stories of the world’s women mathematicians, in portraits

content: Rama Rao also questioned the silence of Union Coal Minister G. Kishan Reddy in the matter and sought to know whether the BJP was also party to the scam

title: India among Russia's top foreign trade partners: PM Mishustin
